entries.title: Heavy Snow in Japan Leaves 17 Dead, Dozens Injured
entries.description: A resident shovels snow off around a car at a parking lot in Kitami city Hokkaido prefecture, northern Japan, on Dec. 24 2022. (Kyodo News via AP)

entries.title: Passenger Advocate Urges Stranded Sunwing Passengers in Mexico to Take Legal Action
entries.description: A Sunwing aircraft is parked at the Montreal Trudeau airport in a file photo. (The Canadian Press/Paul Chiasson)

entries.title: Youth Crime Increases in Australian State, Greens Push to Increase Age of Criminal Responsibility
entries.description: Victoria police logo photographed in Melbourne, Australia on March 24, 2016.(Scott Barbour/Getty Images)

entries.title: Revise Access to Information Law to Restrict Withholding Vital Information From Public: Canada’s Largest Federal Public Service Union
entries.description: The Canadian flag flies near the Peace tower on Parliament Hill in Ottawa, on June 17, 2020. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Nearly Half of Canadians Want a Federal Election in 2023: Poll
entries.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau delivers an address at the Laurier Club Holiday Event, an event for supporters of the Liberal Party of Canada, in Gatineau, Que., on Dec. 15, 2022. (Justin Tang/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Freedom Convoy 2 to Gather in Winnipeg in February
entries.description: Trucks from the convoy protest against COVID-19 mandates and restrictions are parked on a road in Ottawa on Jan. 30, 2022. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Putin Vows to Destroy US-Made Patriot Missile Systems Promised to Ukraine
entries.description: U.S. soldiers stand next to the long-range air defense system Patriot during Toburq Legacy 2017 air defense exercise in the military airfield near Siauliai, Lithuania, on July 20, 2017. (Ints Kalnins/Reuters)

entries.title: UK to Stop Publishing COVID-19 Projections
entries.description: Undated file photo of a COVID-19 test kit. (Danny Lawson/PA Media)

entries.title: Cory Morgan: Trudeau’s Admission That the Health System Is ‘Broken’ Should Be a Catalyst for Reform
entries.description: Ambulances are parked at the entrance to the emergency department at Richmond General Hospital in Richmond, B.C., on Nov. 27, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)

entries.title: Anthony Furey: The Madness of Electric Vehicle Mandates
entries.description: An electric vehicle is charged in Ottawa on July 13, 2022. (Sean Kilpatrick/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Iran Accuses ‘UK-Linked’ Foreign Nationals of Fomenting Unrest
entries.description: A police motorcycle burns during a protest over the death of Mahsa Amini, a woman who died after being arrested by the Islamic republic's "morality police", in Tehran, Iran, on Sept. 19, 2022. (West Asia News Agency via Reuters)

entries.title: 90 Illegal Immigrants Crossed English Channel to Reach UK on Christmas Day
entries.description: An inflatable craft carrying illegal immigrants crosses the shipping lane in the English Channel off the coast of Dover, England, on Aug. 4, 2022. (Dan Kitwood/Getty Images)

entries.title: Police in Australia Ask People to Snitch On ‘Conspiracy Theorist’ Neighbors
entries.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian gives a COVID-19 update in Sydney, Australia, on Sept. 27, 2021. (Joel Carrett - Pool/Getty Images)

entries.title: South Korea Fires Warning Shots After North Flies Drones Across Border
entries.description: A North Korean flag flutters in the wind atop a 160-meter tower in North Korea's village Gijungdongseen, as seen from the Taesungdong freedom village inside the demilitarized zone in Paju, South Korea, on April 27, 2018. (Lee Jin-man via AP)

entries.title: BOJ Kuroda Dismisses Near-Term Chance of Exiting Easy Policy
entries.description: Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda speaks at a news conference in Tokyo on Dec. 19, 2019. (Kim Kyung-Hoon/Reuters)

entries.title: China Lacks ‘Zero-COVID’ Exit Plan, Refuses International Help Amid Huge Spike in Cases
entries.description: A woman wears a mask to protect against the spread of COVID-19 as she waits at a bus stop on a usually busy street in the Central Business District on December 6, 2022 in Beijing, China.  (Kevin Frayer/Getty Images)

entries.title: Beijing Sends 7 Ships and 71 Planes to Taiwan in 24 Hours
entries.description: A helicopter and boat under the Eastern Theatre Command of China's People's Liberation Army (PLA) take part in a maritime rescue drill, as part of military exercises in the waters around Taiwan, at an undisclosed location on Aug. 9, 2022. (Eastern Theatre Command/Handout via Reuters)

entries.title: Thousands Remain in the Dark Days After Fierce Storms Knocked Out Power
entries.description: A fallen tree is shown next to a road in Montreal on Dec. 24, 2022, following a winter storm in the region. (The Canadian Press/Graham Hughes)

entries.title: 6 Passengers Killed When Bus Plunges Into River in Spain
entries.description: Emergency services work at the scene of an accident where a passenger bus plunged off a bridge into the river Lerez in Cerdedo-Cotobade, northwestern Spain, on Dec. 25, 2022. (Guardia Civil/Handout via Reuters)

entries.title: Toyota’s November Global Vehicle Production Rises 1.5 Percent to Record 833,104
entries.description: A Toyota Motor Corp. worker inspects a Yaris on the production line of the company's plant in Onnaing, near Valenciennes, France, on May 17, 2017. (Benoit Tessier/Reuters)

entries.title: All Missing People Found Alive After Austrian Avalanche: APA
entries.description: Members of the emergency services working near the scene of an avalanche at Bregenz, Austria, on Dec. 25, 2022. (APA/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Russia ‘Has All Capabilities’ to Restore Gas Supplies to Europe Through Yamal–Europe Pipeline: Deputy Prime Minister
entries.description: A worker turns a valve at a gas compressor station at the Yamal–Europe pipeline near Nesvizh, some 81 miles southwest of Minsk, Belarus, on Dec. 29, 2006. (Vasily Fedosenko/Reuters)

entries.title: Merck’s COVID-19 Antiviral Drug Doesn’t Reduce Hospitalization or Death in High-Risk Vaccinated People: Study
entries.description: A COVID-19 treatment pill, called Molnupiravir, developed by Merck & Co. Inc. and Ridgeback Biotherapeutics LP, is seen in this undated handout photo released by Merck & Co Inc., on Oct. 26, 2021. (Merck & Co Inc./Reuters)

entries.title: Christmas Has Strayed From Its True Spirit
entries.description: St Mary's Cathedral is illuminated with Christmas themed projections in celebration of Christmas in Sydney, Australia, on Dec. 21, 2021. (Brendon Thorne/Getty Images)

entries.title: Sydney Steeped in Christmas Holiday Cheer With Market Stalls, Christmas Trees, Live Performances
entries.description: St Mary's Cathedral is illuminated with Christmas themed projections in celebration of Christmas on December 21, 2021 in Sydney, Australia. (Photo by Brendon Thorne/Getty Images)

entries.title: Dozens of People Hospitalized by Ammonia Leak in Serbia
entries.description: File phot of a Serbian ambulance. (BalkansCat/Shutterstock)

entries.title: At Least 3 Dead, 4 Missing in Spain After Bus Plunges Off Bridge Into River
entries.description: Emergency services work at the scene of an accident where a passenger bus plunged off a bridge into the river Lerez in Cerdedo-Cotobade, northwestern Spain, on Dec. 25, 2022. (Guardia Civil/Handout via Reuters)

entries.title: Report: 2 Missing After Austria Avalanche, Fewer Than Feared
entries.description: Members of the emergency services working near the scene of an avalanche at Bregenz, Austria, on Dec. 25, 2022. (APA/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: China Sends 71 Warplanes, 7 Ships Toward Taiwan in 24 Hours
entries.description: A Chinese PLA J-16 fighter jet flies in an undisclosed location in a file photo. (Taiwan Ministry of Defense via AP)

entries.title: Maoist Former Rebel Leader Becomes Nepal’s New Prime Minister
entries.description: Leader of communist party Nepal, Pushpa Kamal Dahal, greets the gathering after announcing his resignation as prime minister, in line with an agreement made with his coalition partner party, in Kathmandu, Nepal, on May 24, 2017. (Niranjan Shrestha/AP Photo)

entries.title: Police Charge Hamilton, Ont., Woman After 11 People Injured in Dog Attack
entries.description: A police-issued Taser gun is displayed at the Victoria police station in Victoria in a file photo. (The Canadian Press/Jonathan Hayward)
